direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate the class attribute of elements, but in opposite ways (adding vs. removing).
Both methods involve class attribute manipulation, with toggleClass adding or removing based on the current state.
Both methods remove attributes from elements, though they target different attributes (class vs. general attributes).
Both methods involve attribute manipulation, but attr sets or updates attributes while removeClass removes them.
Both methods perform operations that clear content from elements, though empty removes all child nodes while removeClass removes a specific class.
Both methods remove elements or content from the DOM, though remove removes the elements themselves while removeClass removes a class from the elements.
The select method is used to find elements, which could be a precursor to applying removeClass to them.
The filterOut method could be used to filter elements before applying removeClass, indicating a potential dependency.
